snippet: The former Maldives president, Mohamed Nasheed, repeated charges on Friday that he was forced from power and called for early elections to be held.
abstract: Former Maldives Pres Mohamed Nasheed demands that his replacement Mohammed Waheed Hassan step down and hold early elections; calls for international pressure to stop country's security services from beating his supporters; Nasheed resigned in what he says was a coup only days before, and he has rallied hundreds of supporters in the capital Male in defiance of an arrest warrant issued against him.

byline.original: By VIKAS BAJAJ and SRUTHI GOTTIPATI
byline.contributor: Vikas Bajaj reported from Male, and Sruthi Gottipati from New Delhi. Hari Kumar contributed reporting from New Delhi, and Kevin Drew from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: The former Maldives president, Mohamed Nasheed, repeated charges on Friday that he was forced from power and called for early elections to be held.

headline.seo: Amid Turmoil in Maldives, Mohamed Nasheed, Ex-President, Calls for Elections
headline.main: Maldives’ Former Leader Calls for Early Elections
headline.print_headline: Amid Unrest in Maldives, Ex-Leader Calls for Elections and Successor’s Resignation

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
